result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna B Vining was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

07-10-2015 - Court orders Miss Vining to pay $1250 restitution payable David Lingle

--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--Undergo any mental health assessment, and follow-through with all treatment as recommended by DOC

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral DA Case#14JE1402 (dov: 3/4/14), misdemeanor theft and bars it from further prosecution

Arresting Agency: WTPD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:31 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Donna B Vining in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall provides status update of restitution issue; $1250 is the amt. not covered by insurance company
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that they are not contesting amount

Court orders Miss Vining to pay $1250 restitution payable David Lingle
Recess: 2:33 pm

NEXT: Clerk to AMEND JOC
Letter from JCSD advising huber has been revoked
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Restitution hearing on July 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with attached victim restitution request form(s)
Amended

Case called at 2:00 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Donna B Vining in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files amended information; Service of AMENDED information admitted; reading waived
Atty Zarwell submits plea paperwork & letters in support of Def. 

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral DA Case#14JE1402 (dov: 3/4/14), misdemeanor theft and bars it from further prosecution
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 5/28/15 by 7:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Undergo any mental health assessment, and follow-through with all treatment as recommended by DOC
--No contact with David Lingle, or be present at his residence
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--Take all medications as prescribed by treating physicians
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution as determined at restitution hearing, payable to David Lingle
--To pay 10% restitution surcharge, to be determined

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court orders treatment letters to be sealed
Recess: 2:28 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Restitution Hearing 7/10/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
Status conference on May 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 2:41am[MO]
Defendant Donna B Vining in court with attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Zarwell indicates that another Pretrial Conference is needed for Atty. Zarwell to provide the State with medical information that may impact plea agreement.

recess: 2:42pm--reconvene:2:52pm

Ms. Vining  waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:

--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered

On questioning of the Court, Ms. Vining corrects her address to 418 1/2 Monroe St, NOT 408.
